meanings.sent1: The little scapegrace always found a way to sneak out of the house.
meanings.sent2: The town's scapegrace was known for playing pranks on everyone.
meanings.sent3: The scapegrace thought it would be funny to hide all the shoes in the house.
meanings.sent4: His mischievous grin gave away his true nature as a scapegrace.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the scapegrace with a twinkle in his eye, for trouble follows him like a shadow.

meanings.sent1: The old man warned the children to stay away from the known scapegrace in town.
meanings.sent2: The cunning scapegrace managed to swindle his way out of every situation.
meanings.sent3: The scapegrace tried to sell fake potions as a get-rich-quick scheme.
meanings.sent4: His reputation as a scapegrace preceded him wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The notorious scapegrace was finally caught red-handed by the authorities.
